publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1249 Ms Sandra White: Rector of Glasgow University-That the Parliament agrees that the position of Rector of Glasgow University is one that carries considerable responsibility as well as bestowing honour and dignity upon the holder of the post; notes with concern the views of many students of Glasgow University who are calling for the resignation of the current Rector Mr Ross Kemp on the basis that he has failed in many of his Rectorial duties, including failing to give the freshers' address in two successive years and to hold surgeries as promised, and therefore supports the students of Glasgow University and calls for his immediate resignation as Rector.

S1M-1249 Ms Sandra White: Rector of Glasgow University—That the Parliament agrees that the position of Rector of Glasgow University is one that carries considerable responsibility as well as bestowing honour and dignity upon the holder of the post; notes with concern the views of many students of Glasgow University who are calling for the resignation of the current Rector Mr Ross Kemp, on the basis that he has failed in many of his Rectorial duties, including failing to give the freshers’ address in two successive years and to hold surgeries as promised, and therefore supports the students of Glasgow University and calls for his immediate resignation as Rector. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Fiona McLeod*, Fergus Ewing*, Colin Campbell*
S1M-1249 Rector of Glasgow University (lodged on 5 October 2000) Shona Robison*, Andrew Wilson*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Michael Russell*
S1M-1249 Rector of Glasgow University (lodged on 5 October 2000) Dr Winnie Ewing*

S1M-1249 Ms Sandra White: Rector of Glasgow University—That the Parliament agrees that the position of Rector of Glasgow University is one that carries considerable responsibility as well as bestowing honour and dignity upon the holder of the post; notes with concern the views of many students of Glasgow University who are calling for the resignation of the current Rector Mr Ross Kemp, on the basis that he has failed in many of his Rectorial duties, including failing to give the freshers’ address in two successive years and to hold surgeries as promised, and therefore supports the students of Glasgow University and calls for his immediate resignation as Rector. Supported by: Mr Kenneth Gibson, Fiona McLeod, Fergus Ewing, Colin Campbell, Shona Robison, Andrew Wilson, Nicola Sturgeon, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Michael Russell, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr Lloyd Quinan*
S1M-1249 Rector of Glasgow University (lodged on 5 October 2000) Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-1249 Rector of Glasgow University (lodged on 5 October 2000) Margaret Smith*
